poses.name: Pranamasana
poses.description: Prayer Pose: Stand tall with feet together, palms joined at the heart center in Anjali Mudra. Ground yourself and set an intention.
benefits: Calms the mind and centers awareness
Prepares the body and mind for practice

poses.name: Hasta Uttanasana
poses.description: Raised Arms Pose: Inhale deeply, stretching both arms upwards and arching the back slightly from the upper back. Keep biceps close to the ears.
benefits: Stretches the shoulders, chest, and abdomen
Tones the arms and shoulder muscles

poses.name: Hasta Padasana
poses.description: Hand to Foot Pose (Standing Forward Bend): Exhale, bend forward from the hips, keeping the spine straight initially. Try to place palms flat on the floor beside the feet or hold ankles.
benefits: Stretches hamstrings, calves, and the entire back
Calms the brain and helps relieve stress

poses.name: Ashwa Sanchalanasana
poses.description: Equestrian Pose: Inhale, step one leg back (e.g., right leg), placing the knee on the floor. Bend the front knee, push pelvis forward, lift the chest, and look up.
benefits: Stretches hip flexors, quadriceps, and spine

poses.name: Plank Pose
poses.description: Plank Pose (Phalakasana): Hold breath briefly or exhale, step the front leg back to join the other. Align the body in a straight line from head to heels, engaging the core.
benefits: Strengthens core, arms, wrists, and shoulders
Prepares for more challenging arm balances

poses.name: Ashtanga Namaskara
poses.description: Eight Limb Pose: Exhale, gently lower the knees, chest, and chin to the floor simultaneously. Keep the hips slightly raised and elbows tucked in.
benefits: Prepares for Cobra or Upward-Facing Dog

poses.name: Bhujangasana
poses.description: Cobra Pose: Inhale, slide forward and lift the chest off the floor, keeping the pelvis down. Straighten arms slightly or fully, arching the back gently. Roll shoulders back and down.

poses.name: Adho Mukha Svanasana
poses.description: Downward-Facing Dog Pose: Exhale, lift hips up and back, forming an inverted 'V' shape. Press hands firmly into the floor, lengthen spine, and reach heels towards the floor.
benefits: Stretches shoulders, hamstrings, calves, and hands
Energizes the body and calms the mind

poses.name: Tadasana
poses.description: Mountain Pose: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart or together, arms relaxed by the sides, palms facing forward or thighs. Engage core, lengthen spine, ground feet.

poses.name: Relaxed
poses.description: Neutral standing or sitting posture, monitoring for general alignment and ease.
